titleStmt.title: An epitome of chronicles Conteyninge the whole discourse of the histories as well of this realme of England, as al other cou[n]treys, with the succession of their kinges, the time of their reigne, and what notable actes they did ... gathered out of most probable auctours. Firste by Thomas Lanquet, from the beginning of the worlde to the incarnacion of Christe, secondely to the reigne of our soueraigne lord king Edward the sixt by Thomas Cooper, and thirdly to the reigne of our soueraigne Ladye Quene Elizabeth, by Robert Crowley. Anno. 1559.
titleStmt.author: Lanquet, Thomas, 1521-1545.
Cooper, Thomas, 1517?-1594. aut
Crowley, Robert, 1518?-1588. aut

publicationStmt.publisher: [Printed by William Seres] in ædibus Thomæ Marshe,

notesStmt.note: Colophon reads: Imprinted at London by VVilliam Seres at the weste ende of Paules towards Ludgate at the signe of the Hedgehogge and are there to be solde. 1559. The. v. day of Apryll.
A pirated edition, repudiated by Cooper in STC 15218 et seq.
A leaf signed 2Q3 is inserted after 2Q2.
Identified as STC 15221 on UMI microfilm.
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
